discussion.content: Enable B2B Direct Connect: Configure cross-tenant access settings in Microsoft Entra ID to establish mutual trust between your organization and the external organization
According to copilot the answer is "B2B direct connect"

comments.content:
why not using B2B Collaboration
While Microsoft Entra B2B Collaboration is useful for inviting external users (guests) to access your organization's resources securely, it is not the best fit for scenarios involving Teams shared channels where seamless, ongoing collaboration is required without switching accounts or tenants.

Here’s why B2B Collaboration isn't ideal in this case:

B2B Collaboration relies on inviting users as guests, requiring them to switch organizations in Teams to access shared resources.

It is best suited for granting external users access to specific internal resources like SharePoint, Teams, or other Microsoft 365 apps as one-time or limited access.

In contrast, B2B Direct Connect enables direct trust relationships between organizations, allowing employees to collaborate in Teams shared channels seamlessly, without the need for account switching or re-authentication. It’s purpose-built for this kind of cross-organization collaboration.

Solution: You deploy Office Home and Business 2016.

discussion.content: Only Office 365 ProPlus can be bought with subscription, other version of office, including the 2016 version can be bought only by license, so the answer is B.

O Office Home and Business 2016 não é uma versão baseada em assinatura do Microsoft Office. É uma versão tradicional do Office, que é vendida com uma licença perpétua. Para aplicar configurações do aplicativo do Office por meio de políticas de grupo, você precisaria de uma versão baseada em assinatura, como o Microsoft 365 Apps (anteriormente conhecido como Office 365 ProPlus). O Microsoft 365 Apps é a versão do Office que pode ser implantada e gerenciada por meio de políticas de grupo em um ambiente empresarial.

Portanto, a resposta correta é:

B. Não.
Also none of the Office suites do support GPO's (ProPlus only)

Office Home and Business 2016 are volume licensing based and are not subscription based. 

 In software licensing, a volume licensing is the practice of selling a license authorizing one computer program to be used on a large number of computers or by a large number of users.
